page.title: 05CUSTOMS/LEGENDS _ BORTH
page.content: {Cantre'r Gwaelod} was supposedly made up of 100 villages surrounded by a very strong wall to keep the sea out. Guards opened and closed the sluice_ gates, but one night, two guards drank too much and forgot, so that all the villages except Borth were drowned. Wallog Bay,south of Borth has an outcrop of rocks, Sarn Cynfelin,claim_ ed to be the remains of the destroyed wall.Some claim to have heard tinkling bells from the drowned villages. {Traeth Maelgwyn }When the ruler of West Wales died, they had a contest to choose a successor. Everyone eligible took a chair to the sea's edge and the person who sat longest as the tide came in was to be crowned ruler. Maelgwyn was the local chieftain. His servant built a chair covered with waxed birds' wings. When everyone else fell, Maelgwyn floated, and won.
